values.account.created: Occurs whenever a new account is created.
values.account.updated: Occurs whenever an account is updated.
values.credit.canceled: Occurs whenever a credit is canceled.
values.credit.created: Occurs whenever a new credit is created.
values.credit.failed: Occurs whenever a credit is rejected.
values.credit.succeeded: Occurs whenever a credit is successfully captured or deposited.
values.credit.updated: Occurs whenever a credit is updated.
values.debit.canceled: Occurs whenever a debit is canceled.
values.debit.created: Occurs whenever a new debit is created.
values.debit.failed: Occurs whenever a debit is rejected.
values.debit.succeeded: Occurs whenever a debit is successfully captured or withdrawn.
values.debit.updated: Occurs whenever a debit is updated.
values.hold.captured: Occurs whenever a hold is captured.
values.hold.created: Occurs whenever a new hold is created.
values.hold.updated: Occurs whenever a hold is updated.
values.hold.voided: Occurs whenever a hold is voided.
values.refund.canceled: Occurs whenever a refund is canceled.
values.refund.created: Occurs whenever a new refund is created.
values.refund.failed: Occurs whenever a refund is rejected.
values.refund.succeeded: Occurs whenever a refund is successfully captured or deposited.
values.refund.updated: Occurs whenever a refund is updated.

fields.validate:
URI referencing the account of the merchant whom the debit is being
done on behalf of. This is different from marketplace. In a
peer-to-peer transaction, there are three parties:

1. Marketplace
2. Seller/Service provider
3. Buyer

This merchant account represents **2**.

:param field: Either on_behalf_of_uri and merchant_uri
:param account: This is a merchant account on a marketplace

fields.default:

is the ``amount`` associated with that hold. Otherwise no default
is provided and this field is **required**.
fields.description:
If the resolving URI references a hold then this is hold amount. You can
always capture less than the hold amount (e.g. a partial capture).
Otherwise its the maximum per debit amount for your marketplace.

fields.description:
Resolves a particular field of an object (e.g. o.some.random.field). It
will also check if this object is part is part of a cycle as indicated by
context's `cycle` attribute and what to do about it as indicated by
context's `cycle_default` attribute. If SKIP then the spec returns NONE
indicating the spec should be ignored otherwise a ValueError is raised.

`name`
    The name of the field to pull off the object and return. If name is
    None (the default) it is taken from context's `name` attribute. For
    details on how fields are parsed and how they resolve to the attribute
    value(s) of an object see `resolve_field`.

`default`
    Determines how to handle the case where the field cannot be resolved
    for an object which should be either SKIP or NONE. If SKIP then the
    spec will return NONE when the field cannot be resolved otherwise it is
    NONE and an AttributeError is raised.
